task_description: Facing the building to your North (approx. 1°), estimate the height of the main building in front of you in meters. Answer with one number and a short rationale.

reason: The building is directly ahead but the current pitch (0°) may not show its full height; rotating upward will reveal the roofline for accurate height estimation.
The current upward pitch (30°) shows the upper portion of the building but likely obscures the base; rotating downward will reveal the ground level to measure total height from foundation to roof.

After observing the building's base at -30° pitch and roofline at +30° pitch, the total vertical angle spans ~60°. Assuming a typical viewing distance of ~10m (from available move distances), the height calculates to approximately 17.3m using trigonometry (10m * tan(60°)).
